text: It’s likely that whatever script you’re loading that is using jQuery is just loading before the actual jQuery script
Hello. We have tags A, B, and C on blog posts. Can we count for a contact which tag he visite (ie: tag A : 3 visits)?

Which does your team use?
• :a:  = Figma
• :b: = AdobeXD
• :cl: = Sketch
Vote using emoji or if "other", please comment in the :thread:
If you use something else ... please comment here. :slightly_smiling_face:

My developers and I are having still really bad caching since yesterday, we have to constantly use a new hsCacheBuster number to see updates we are pushing to our portals, it is becoming a pain, is there a reason this is happening on Test Portals?
I still use Sketch for some projects, but after one test project on Figma,  I've become a true believer. Live editing and auto layout are  game changers

Wish I could get our designers to move more to Figma (largely, selfishly, because I went to the dark side and am now on PC), but I'm excited about the announcement of real-time collaboration coming soon to Sketch
Not sure - but you may be able to append `<!--{{ local_dt }} -->` to the top of your theme to kill caching, but i’d make sure you delete it before pushing it live.

Is there is a way to update HubSpot contacts using the CRM-contacts-API with Google Tag Manager? I've determined I can trigger a custom html tag which would have javascript in it, that would make an ajax call to a php file (to hide the api key). That seems like a convoluted way now that I'm knee deep in it. Any suggestions?
XD is pretty powerful as well.. i am not sure why people discount it so much.

<@U38EZFVFE> - I've made a couple of smaller projects in XD, but some of the library, layout tools, and auto positioning/resizing in XD don't feel as intuitive to me as Sketch or Figma. Maybe I've just not been using it with the right plug-ins?
I like the idea of using software that plays a little more nicely with Illustrator and Photoshop, even though I resent how much money I give Adobe every year
